condition.description:
Diarrhea means that you have loose, watery stools more than three times in one day. You may also have cramps, bloating, nausea and an urgent need to have a bowel movement.

Causes of diarrhea include bacteria, viruses or parasites, certain medicines, food intolerances and diseases that affect the stomach, small intestine or colon. In many cases, no cause can be found.

Although usually not harmful, diarrhea can become dangerous or signal a more serious problem. You should talk to your doctor if you have a strong pain in your abdomen or rectum, a fever, blood in your stools, severe diarrhea for more than three days or symptoms of dehydration. If your child has diarrhea, do not hesitate to call the doctor for advice. Diarrhea can be dangerous in children.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
condition.name: Diarrhea
symptoms: Urgent need to have a bowel movement

carousel_items: Try to drink plenty of clear liquids. Having diarrhea can make you dehydrated.
The correct dose of Imodium may be different depending on age. Use the dosing chart to find the right amount of medicine based on age and weight.
Shake Imodium liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
Check with your baby doctor before using if you're breastfeeding.
Ask your doctor before taking Imodium if you have a fever, liver problems, mucus in your stool or are taking antibiotics.
Don't use if you have blood in your stool or it's dark or black in color.
Stop using Imodium and call your doctor if you have pain, swelling or bulging in your belly or your symptoms get worse after 2 days. This could be serious.

basics.benefits_moa: Imodium is an antidiarrheal medicine. It's actually an opioid related to morphine, though it doesn't affect the brain like opioid pain medicines do. Instead, it works directly on muscles in your large intestine to stop contractions and increase the time it takes for stool to move through. The result is less diarrhea and more formed stool.
basics.bottom_line: One day is too many days to have diarrhea. Having Imodium on hand to relieve your symptoms can be a life-saver.
downsides: Imodium only treats your diarrhea symptoms. Diarrhea may be caused by a number of conditions and will need specific treatment that deals with the underlying issue.

Studies in people taking Imodium for chronic diarrhea showed if the maximum number of doses didn't relieve symptoms in 10 days, then it probably won't work for that condition. You can talk to your doctor about other treatment options.

downsides_processed.orig: Imodium only treats your diarrhea symptoms. Diarrhea may be caused by a number of conditions and will need specific treatment that deals with the underlying issue.

Studies in people taking Imodium for chronic diarrhea showed if the maximum number of doses didn't relieve symptoms in 10 days, then it probably won't work for that condition. You can talk to your doctor about other treatment options.

upsides: Most people who take Imodium feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.
Imodium is used for short-term, chronic and traveler's diarrhea. It's also used for people who have diarrhea caused by cancer or certain medicines that treat cancer.

upsides_processed.orig: Most people who take Imodium feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.
Imodium is used for short-term, chronic and traveler's diarrhea. It's also used for people who have diarrhea caused by cancer or certain medicines that treat cancer.

userStories.tip: Generic loperamide is cheaper and works just as well as Imodium.

drugs.name: Imodium

labeled_indications.indication: Chronic diarrhea from Irritable Bowel Syndrome

off-label_indications.indication: Surgical removal of the rectum and colon

carousel_items_processed.orig: Try to drink plenty of clear liquids. Having diarrhea can make you dehydrated.
The correct dose of Imodium may be different depending on age. Use the dosing chart to find the right amount of medicine based on age and weight.
Shake Imodium liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
Check with your baby doctor before using if you're breastfeeding.
Ask your doctor before taking Imodium if you have a fever, liver problems, mucus in your stool or are taking antibiotics.
Don't use if you have blood in your stool or it's dark or black in color.
Stop using Imodium and call your doctor if you have pain, swelling or bulging in your belly or your symptoms get worse after 2 days. This could be serious.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Very rarely, Imodium has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Very rarely, Imodium has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Imodium lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Liver problems
risks_warnings.description: Imodium is broken down by the liver. If you have liver problems, talk to your doctor. You may need a different dose, (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label) or another medicine to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Imodium is broken down by the liver. If you have liver problems, talk to your doctor. You may need a different dose, (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label) or another medicine to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Serious intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Do not use if you have diarrhea with a high fever, blood in your stool, pain, swelling or bulging in your belly. People taking HIV medicine together with Imodium can have a serious intestinal problem called toxic megacolon.  Call your doctor or get medical care right away if you develop these symptoms or your diarrhea gets worse after 2 days.

description_processed.orig: Do not use if you have diarrhea with a high fever, blood in your stool, pain, swelling or bulging in your belly. People taking HIV medicine together with Imodium can have a serious intestinal problem called toxic megacolon.  Call your doctor or get medical care right away if you develop these symptoms or your diarrhea gets worse after 2 days.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Using Imodium is not recommended during pregnancy or if you're breast-feeding. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Using Imodium is not recommended during pregnancy or if you're breast-feeding. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

carousel_items: Chew or dissolve chewable tablets in mouth.
Shake Pepto Bismol liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
You can take a dose every 1/2 to 1 hour but don't take more than 8 doses in 24 hours.
Chewable tablets and liquid are not for children under 12 years.
Use until diarrhea stops but not more than 2 days. Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't go away after 2 days.
Don't take Pepto Bismol if you have an allergy to aspirin or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs).

Don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who have or are getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reye's Syndrome. Reye's syndrome causes brain and liver damage.
Can temporarily make your tongue and stools darker.
Stop taking Pepto Bismol and tell your doctor if you notice ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea and vomiting.
Not a good choice if you have stomach bleeding, bleeding problems, diabetes, gout or are taking medicines to thin your blood.

basics.benefits_moa: Pepto Bismol is a stomach and intestine medicine with multiple effects. It relieves diarrhea by helping your intestines absorb water and electrolytes, and by lowering intestine inflammation and movement. It also has antibacterial and antacid effects.
basics.bottom_line: Pepto Bismol does it all, from upset stomach to crampy diarrhea.
downsides: You might be surprised that Pepto Bismol can cause temporary darkening of your tongue, but it's harmless.
Doesn't treat every intestinal infection so make sure you let your doctor know if your diarrhea and symptoms last more than 2 days or your symptoms get worse. You may need a stronger medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: You might be surprised that Pepto Bismol can cause temporary darkening of your tongue, but it's harmless.
Doesn't treat every intestinal infection so make sure you let your doctor know if your diarrhea and symptoms last more than 2 days or your symptoms get worse. You may need a stronger medicine.

upsides: Most people who take Pepto Bismol feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It's can also be used as part of treatment plan for H. Pylori., a stomach infection. H. Pylori is thought to be one of the reasons some people get ulcers.
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.

upsides_processed.orig: Most people who take Pepto Bismol feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It's can also be used as part of treatment plan for H. Pylori., a stomach infection. H. Pylori is thought to be one of the reasons some people get ulcers.
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves heartburn, upset tummy and diarrhea.
drugs.name: Pepto Bismol

carousel_items_processed.orig: Chew or dissolve chewable tablets in mouth.
Shake Pepto Bismol liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
You can take a dose every 1/2 to 1 hour but don't take more than 8 doses in 24 hours.
Chewable tablets and liquid are not for children under 12 years.
Use until diarrhea stops but not more than 2 days. Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't go away after 2 days.
Don't take Pepto Bismol if you have an allergy to aspirin or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs).

Don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who have or are getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reye's Syndrome. Reye's syndrome causes brain and liver damage.
Can temporarily make your tongue and stools darker.
Stop taking Pepto Bismol and tell your doctor if you notice ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea and vomiting.
Not a good choice if you have stomach bleeding, bleeding problems, diabetes, gout or are taking medicines to thin your blood.

risks_warnings.title: Reye's syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who are sick with or getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reye’s Syndrome. Reye’s is a serious condition that causes damage to the liver and brain.
risk_factors: Children or teenagers that have or are recovering from flu/flu-like symptoms or chickenpox

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who are sick with or getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reye’s Syndrome. Reye’s is a serious condition that causes damage to the liver and brain.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Using Pepto Bismol, an aspirin-type medicine is not recommended during pregnancy. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Using Pepto Bismol, an aspirin-type medicine is not recommended during pregnancy. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. People who are allergic to aspirin can have a reaction to Pepto Bismol. Stop taking Pepto Bismol and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. People who are allergic to aspirin can have a reaction to Pepto Bismol. Stop taking Pepto Bismol and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Bleeding problems
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. If you have a history of stomach or intestinal problems that include ulcers or bleeding or if you have a bleeding problem (hemophilia) you may be at risk of bleeding. The chances this happens is greater the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Drinking 3 or more alcoholic drinks a day

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. If you have a history of stomach or intestinal problems that include ulcers or bleeding or if you have a bleeding problem (hemophilia) you may be at risk of bleeding. The chances this happens is greater the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

risks_warnings.title: Hearing problems
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol may cause ringing in ears (tinnitus) and loss of hearing higher tones. Older people are more sensitive and should be careful  not to take too much.

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol may cause ringing in ears (tinnitus) and loss of hearing higher tones. Older people are more sensitive and should be careful  not to take too much.

carousel_items: It's important to take each dose with at least 8 ounces (a full glass) of water or other liquid. Works in about 12-72 hours.
Don't take more than 8 caplets in a 24 hour period without asking your doctor first and not for more than one week.
Don't take Fibercon within 2 hours before or after taking other medicines. It may interact and affect how they work.
If you take Fibercon then have chest pain, vomiting, trouble breathing or swallowing, get medical help immediately.
Ask your doctor before taking Fibercon if you have stomach pain, nausea, vomiting or had sudden changes in your stool for more than 2 weeks.
Ask your doctor about giving Fibercon to anyone younger than 12 years.
Talk to you doctor about eating certain foods and getting more exercise to help prevent your constipation.

basics.benefits_moa: Fibercon is a fiber-based laxative. It adds bulk and moisture to your intestine, which softens stool and makes it easier to pass.
basics.bottom_line: Fibercon is a natural fiber laxative that's safe enough to take during pregnancy. Just make sure you take it with plenty of liquid.
downsides: You may have to take Fibercon daily for 1-3 days to see full effects.
If you don't take it with enough liquid, it could swell and block your throat and cause choking.
Not the best choice for people who have swallowing problems or aren't able to drink lots of liquids.
Can cause heartburn, gas, and belly cramps.

downsides_processed.orig: You may have to take Fibercon daily for 1-3 days to see full effects.
If you don't take it with enough liquid, it could swell and block your throat and cause choking.
Not the best choice for people who have swallowing problems or aren't able to drink lots of liquids.
Can cause heartburn, gas, and belly cramps.

upsides: Some people felt Fibercon was a hassle but still worth it.
It's safe to use short-term during pregnancy and breast-feeding as long as you take it with plenty of liquid, but you should still check with your baby doctor first.
Less gas and bloating compared to psyllium laxative products.

upsides_processed.orig: Some people felt Fibercon was a hassle but still worth it.
It's safe to use short-term during pregnancy and breast-feeding as long as you take it with plenty of liquid, but you should still check with your baby doctor first.
Less gas and bloating compared to psyllium laxative products.

drugs.name: Fibercon

carousel_items_processed.orig: It's important to take each dose with at least 8 ounces (a full glass) of water or other liquid. Works in about 12-72 hours.
Don't take more than 8 caplets in a 24 hour period without asking your doctor first and not for more than one week.
Don't take Fibercon within 2 hours before or after taking other medicines. It may interact and affect how they work.
If you take Fibercon then have chest pain, vomiting, trouble breathing or swallowing, get medical help immediately.
Ask your doctor before taking Fibercon if you have stomach pain, nausea, vomiting or had sudden changes in your stool for more than 2 weeks.
Ask your doctor about giving Fibercon to anyone younger than 12 years.
Talk to you doctor about eating certain foods and getting more exercise to help prevent your constipation.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Fibercon can affect how other medicines are absorbed in the body when you take them together. Make sure you take it 2 hours before or after other medicines and vitamins.

description_processed.orig: Fibercon can affect how other medicines are absorbed in the body when you take them together. Make sure you take it 2 hours before or after other medicines and vitamins.

risks_warnings.title: Bowel blockage
risks_warnings.description: Stop taking Fibercon and call your doctor right away if you have nausea, vomiting, pain or bulging in your belly that doesn't go away, have rectal bleeding, and no bowel movement after taking. These may be symptoms of a bowel blockage (bowel obstruction) which is serious.
risk_factors: Other condition that causes blockage or narrowing of bowel

description_processed.orig: Stop taking Fibercon and call your doctor right away if you have nausea, vomiting, pain or bulging in your belly that doesn't go away, have rectal bleeding, and no bowel movement after taking. These may be symptoms of a bowel blockage (bowel obstruction) which is serious.
